Going last December. Koreans really like to visit China Street in Incheon, because this is the most authentic China Street in South Korea. In recent years, Koreans have become more and more fond of Chinese culture. Xiao Jin has not been to China Street in other countries, so he can't compare. As a Northeaster, Xiaojin also likes to visit here. The longer you age, the more you can deeply experience the greatness of Chinese culture. [Eat]: Xiaojin ate at lunch that day in the "Wanduofu" restaurant, and lunch was to be queued. It's really delicious. China Street and Japan Street and Matsuyuedong mural village are connected together, you can go shopping together.
Not bad, it is worth a visit.
It was a place that felt like a Chinese temple. It's fun. Must visit when traveling to Incheon!

The first place where overseas Chinese lived in Korea. It used to be a place for Chinese leases, Japanese leases and other foreign leases. Now it has become a tourist attraction for Korean nationals. In fact, the Dalin Cave generation in Seoul is the place where Chinese people live together.

This Chinatown is the largest in South Korea, and its history can be traced back to the birth of Incheon Port. In 1883, the location of the Chinatown was designated as the extraterritorial jurisdiction (concession) of the Qing government in 1884, and Chinese people from and to South Korea gathered, gradually forming the Chinese street. There are about 40 Chinese restaurants and shops, and there are Chinese-style archways on both sides of the street. There is also a museum of fried noodles, which is regarded as a representative work of Chinese cuisine in South Korea. In addition, there are some facilities related to China such as Overseas Chinese Elementary School, Chu Hanzhi, and Sanguozhi Mural Street.

As far as Korea is concerned, Chinatown is really not much, or it can be called Chinatown. Incheon Chinatown is most famous for its miscellaneous sauce noodles. The most famous dishes are fried sauce noodles and seafood spicy noodles. Each restaurant will have its own special dishes or two. Incheon Chinatown was designated as a Chinese settlement after the Qing government's extraterritorial jurisdiction in 1884. It's fitting to come here and learn about the history of Korean Chinese. In the past, most of the shops selling Chinese products here are now Chinese restaurants. In addition, I would like to remind you that most of the Chinese living in Chinatown today are descendants of the second or third generation of early immigrants. Almost everyone has become Korean. The "Chinese Heart" has become very thin, but Chinese cuisine is still very authentic. The Chinese red people in the streets can still feel a strong Chinese flavor. According to my personal experience, the Chinese city must experience a few - "1, fried sauce noodles (Korean people say the most famous is Republican Spring, but in fact this Republican Spring is no longer run by Chinese people, so you do not have to line up here to eat, because there are many cheap and delicious fried sauce noodles in other homes. ) 2. Chinese and Japanese buildings. (This is because there was a clear distinction between the dynasty concessions and the Japanese concessions here. There are very obvious historical traces. We must look carefully at each building. Significant) 3. Chinese snacks. Many of these snacks are different from those now sold in China, such as desktop pineapple crisps. They are very delicious here and must be tasted if you have the chance. ) Traditional Chinese Department Store Gonghe Spring Tower Street Snacks Chinatown Street Architecture (presented by Weihai, China) Nightscape Chinese Red
Cool place to get some Chinese food and walk around one of the only official Chinatown's in Korea.
South Korea's largest Chinatown, history can be traced back to the Qing Dynasty, there are Chinese people living here, buy Chinese goods to eat Chinese food, this is of course the best choice.

It feels very rich with Chinese characteristics! ____________ It can be said to be antique! There are many kinds of Chinese snacks! Shaanxi cold skin, meat with steamed buns, Shandong snacks... Have everything that one expects to find! It is said that the Spring Restaurant of the Republic of China was built in the late Qing Dynasty.
It was once the largest Chinese location in South Korea. Most restaurants are opened by Chinese. It mainly sells Chinese goods. It is recommended to visit Korea for tourism.

Incheon does not have many famous attractions, nor is it a popular tourist city, Chinatown is almost a must-see place to Incheon. The American couple in the hostel said that they had been to Chinatown yesterday. It felt great. I liked the ancient buildings there. I also told me to take the subway. It took a long time to transfer the bus, but it was shown on Google Maps. The time to take the subway and take the bus is the same, but the subway has to transfer. The bus seemed to have a time, so I finally decided to take the bus. As a result, the bus still did not have a time. It took nearly two hours to arrive after three turns. It was with the help of a Korean uncle in the car. He just went to Chinatown and asked me to follow him. Sometimes you can’t trust Google Maps. I remember that I also said that Chinatown in every country will not miss it. See how Chinese people live abroad. Compared with the countries I have been to before, I feel that the Chinese people living in Korea are better than other countries. The scale of the restaurant is also large and the business is good. Sure enough, culture is the biggest barrier. Although Chinese and Korean culture is still different, most of them are similar and the food culture is close. The bus stop is next to Chinatown, and the subway station is opposite.

When you come here, you can feel the strong Chinese atmosphere, and the plaques on the street are all Chinese characters that look very kind.

Incheon is located in the western part of South Korea, which is an important maritime port. In modern times, many Chinese people fled from war and hunger. The first stop when they crossed the ocean to South Korea was often Incheon. It happened that Incheon unloaded cargo ships needed labor. Over time, this place became a gathering place for Chinese people, and it was full of the embryonic form of China Street.

It takes about an hour or more to get to Incheon by subway from Seoul. You can see the Chinese Street from Incheon Station. The landmark building is obvious. It's on the weekend. There are so many people that you can visit it.

Incheon Chinatown Incheon Chinatown was once the largest overseas Chinese community in South Korea, and because of its geographical location across the Yellow Sea from Shandong, China, and Weihai across the sea, many Chinese people come to engage in restaurants and other businesses. Incheon Chinatown opened in 1883, and in 1884 the area was designated as an extraterritorial place of the Qing government after the Chinese settlement gradually formed.

Incheon does not have many famous scenic spots, nor is it a popular tourist city. Chinatown is almost the place to go to Incheon. They also told me that it would take me a long time to go by subway. But it was shown on Google Map that the time of taking the subway was the same as that of taking the bus. But the time of taking the subway and taking the bus was the same. But the bus seemed to last until the subway changed, so I decided to go by bus. As a result, the bus didn't arrive until then. It took more than two hours to make three turns. With the help of a Korean uncle on the bus, he just went to Chinatown and asked me to follow him. So sometimes you can't trust Google Maps too much. I remember saying before that Chinatown in every country can't be missed. See how Chinese people live abroad. Compared with the countries they have visited before, they feel that Chinese people living in Korea are better than other countries. The restaurants are larger and the business is good. As a matter of fact, culture is the biggest barrier. Although Chinese and Korean cultures are different, most of them are similar, and their dietary cultures are similar. The bus stop is next to Chinatown, and the subway station is opposite.

It is said that this is the only Chinese city in Korea. A landmark building in Chinatown is a 7-8-storey traditional Chinese-style red building. On the left is the Chinese residential area in Chinatown and on the right is the Japanese area. However, part of Japan moved away after World War II, leaving only the original Japanese architecture.

This is the largest Chinatown in Korea. You have wall paintings in the form of pictures, Confucius statues overlooking Incheon and so on. Architecture also retains the ancient Chinese style. Incheon's Chinatown is Korea's only official Chinatown. It is in Jung-gu and was formed in 1884.It claims to be the largest Chinatown in South Korea, and features an 11-meter high Chinese-style gateway, or paifang.As of 2007 few ethnic Chinese live in the Incheon Chinatown. There are both many food and various attractions in Incheon chinatown.

In fact, this is Chinatown, although not particularly long, but the buildings here have Chinese style, but also very distinctive, there are many delicious Chinese food, fried sauce noodles and steamed noodles.

It was our first visit to this Fairy Tail Village in Seoul. We love it so much as we’ve back to our childhood memories! it’s so colourful n fun taking pictures along the streets as we strolling down 😀😀👍🏼

A good place to visit with children for 2-3 hours on weekends can be parked in the public parking lot. If you look closely, there are unknown public parking lots everywhere. There are also various foods such as oven dumplings

Songwol-dong Fairytale Village history : The opening of Incheon Port in 1883 led to the start of many foreigners coming into the area for settlement.Soon, it became a rich village and many young people gradually moved out, leaving the village in a state of stagnation.As such, a renovation project was brought about to improve the development of the village by painting and decorating classic fairy tales all around.
Maybe it was because I went on weekdays, there were few people and it was easy to take pictures ＾＾
It's also good to take pictures with children and enjoy beautiful pictures
It's a little disappointing that the vibrancy of the past has disappeared, but it was good that the cute mural paintings remained as they were ☺️

The main two streets of the village are quite long, connected by several alleys in the middle, because there are differences in elevation between the two streets. Most of the alleys in the middle are steps, and they are steps with cartoon patterns. Looking from the bottom up, they used to be excellent. In spring, different kinds of flowers are in full bloom, which complement each other with the scenes of characters and animals in childhood. Along the way, there are countless fairy tale protagonists waiting to take photos with visitors. Everyone here is a little prince and princess oh. marshmallow, ice cream, as well as special shops and cafes. Even the parking lot is surrounded by small animals.

Songyuedong fairy tale village is generated in recent years, originally this block many families are elderly with children to live, young people to other areas to struggle, resulting in the atmosphere of the block is not dynamic. Later, in order to solve this situation, the place was specially "reformed", in every wall, corners are carefully decorated into cartoons, and now it has become a dream paradise that attracts countless people. Entering the fairy tale village will make people feel "must be very happy to live in such an environment", surrounded by colorful world. However, because Songyuedong Fairy Tale Village is getting more and more popular, and the location is next to the famous scenic spot China City, there are many people who come here every day. In order to avoid the crowds and enjoy a quiet trip, it is recommended to pass in the morning. At this time, there are fewer people in the block, so you can take pictures as much as you like, but be careful not to disturb the residents.

Songyuedong Fairy Tale Village is carrying China Street. From a distance, you will see many scenes in fairy tales. The house is also painted with fairy tale colors. Many old characters such as Snow White, Puppet Adventures, etc. appear in front of you to regain childhood memories.
The fairy tale village of Incheon, South Korea, is worth visiting, those interesting patterns, full of childhood time.

The fairy tale village is also a very good and fun street, all of which are cartoons and animation images of South Korea. The fairy tale village is also a very fun place. The streets here are also open. The area of this village is also quite atmospheric.

The location is in the area of Fairy Tale Village Road, Zhong District, Incheon City. Metro Line 1, Shuiren Line, Incheon Station Exit 2, about 5 minutes walk. It was originally a gathering area for foreigners after the opening of the Incheon Gate. Now it has been transformed into a romantic and colorful fairy tale theme park. From Snow White to the world of gray and red women Famous books to Korean myths and legends, fairy tales of various subjects and murals or sculptures are decorated in alleys, making it seem to be in a dreamy fairy tale world.

When you still have a pure heart, you can arrange half a day to visit here and feel the fairy-tale village. When I came here, I was really frightened for a day, because I could see a lot of girls here. They all took pictures here, which made me feel a little overwhelmed. The goods here are very lovely, but the price is a little expensive. Let's have a look.

Various pink houses, or designed as castles, or cartoon houses, incorporate various comic characters into the house.
It's good. Like a children's paradise, it's suitable for families to take their children on a trip.

Seoul Zoo, located within the larger Seoul Grand Park complex in Gwacheon, just south of Seoul, South Korea, is one of the country's largest and oldest zoological parks. It offers a wide variety of attractions and educational experiences focused on wildlife conservation, making it a popular destination for families, tourists, and nature enthusiasts.

The treasure of the Seoul Zoo's town garden is the precious Roland gorilla. There is also a chance to see the interaction of the nurses with the animals, and the real life appearance of the cute animals. There is also a botanical area in the zoo, about 900 kinds of plants, in addition to many plant artworks, these are surrounded by the zoo, forming a beautiful forest park, come here to directly enjoy the zoo, botanical garden and forest park happy day
Although the zoo is not very big, but there are all animals, tigers, monkeys, ugly insects... can play for a day

Seoul Zoo, 2.7 million pings of park has more than 360 cute animals. There are many kinds, built entirely by the mountain, there are very good natural conditions such as forest baths, mountain streams, natural ramps, slow flat land, so that animals can be protected and managed in an environment close to natural ecology.

You can’t miss seeing this palace on your trip to Suwon! This is where Joseon Dynasty King Jeonjo lived Hwaseong Palace is a palace where Jeongjo lived temporarily before going to Hyeonlong Garden. Guangming Caves are not naturally formed caves, but artificial caves. It is also the only caves in the Korean capital circle. It was developed in 1912 during the Japanese colonial era, and by 1931, during the Great East Asian War, it became a mineral area for weapons production. There are rich gold, silver, copper, zinc and other substances, and after liberation, it also provided a wealth of materials for the economic construction of South Korea. It is said that in 1972, it was forced to close due to floods, and it was only opened again in 2011, and gradually developed into the bright caves we can see now.
It's really cool if you go in hot summer !! :)

Guangming Cave is a cave theme park built by abandoned mines, which used to take gold, silver, copper and other minerals, and now is built into a space full of mystery after integrating elements of culture and art. There are more than 20 observation facilities in the cave, such as red wine caves, cave Aqua World, Golden Waterfall, Golden Road, Golden Palace, Terror Experience Hall, Underground World of the cave, Underground Lake, Dragon Sculpture, LED Light Space, etc. The weekend will also feature Black Lights.

🔺️ Light Show: The light show in the Guangming Cave is one of the highlights. It is recommended to visit at night, so that you can better appreciate the fantasy effect of the combination of light and the cave. 🔺️ Comfortable wear: Due to the low temperature in the cave, it is recommended to wear comfortable and warm clothes, especially during the cold season. 🔺️ Recommended visit time: There are multiple display areas in the cave, it is recommended to reserve 2-3 hours to visit to fully experience the various characteristics of the cave. 🔺️ There are many stairs in the cave, which need to climb up and down, which is very physical. Guangming Cave perfectly integrates history, nature and art, and is a mysterious tourist attraction suitable for the whole family to explore together.
